content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 70 plus 5 sin open parentheses fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 365 end fraction open parentheses t minus 90 close parentheses close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>365</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>90</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 365"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>365</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> models the temperature of water in a lake, in degrees Fahrenheit, <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> days since January <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Based on the model, the predicted temperature of the water will be greater than <math alttext="72"><semantics><mn>72</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> degrees Fahrenheit for approximately how many days?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
